documenttitle.text: Red Hat Bug Fix Advisory: containernetworking-plugins bug fix and enhancement update

note.text: An updated containernetworking-plugins package that fixes several bugs and adds various enhancements is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 Extras.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
The Container Network Interface (CNI) project consists of a specification and libraries for writing plug-ins for configuring network interfaces in Linux containers, along with a number of supported plug-ins. CNI concerns itself only with network connectivity of containers and removing allocated resources when the container is deleted.

Users of containernetworking-plugins are advised to upgrade to this updated package, which fixes these bugs and add these enhancements.
note.title: Details

note.text: Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) CNI (Container Networking Interface) 0.7.4 has a network firewall misconfiguration which affects Kubernetes. The CNI 'portmap' plugin, used to setup HostPorts for CNI, inserts rules at the front of the iptables nat chains; which take precedence over the KUBE- SERVICES chain. Because of this, the HostPort/portmap rule could match incoming traffic even if there were better fitting, more specific service definition rules like NodePorts later in the chain. The issue is fixed in CNI 0.7.5 and Kubernetes 1.11.9, 1.12.7, 1.13.5, and 1.14.0.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

reference.Description: bz#1692712: Incorrect rule injection in CNI portmap plugin

fullproductname.text: containernetworking-plugins-0:0.7.5-2.el7 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 Extras
